changesets.comments: ui: fixed ETL server detection for humans and bots count, fixes #664

details.name: description
details.old_value:
There are some online Legacy servers using recent -git snapshots (see screenshot). The x86_64 server uses pre.sdl2.570 while the red server uses 573, which is the most recent version as I type this bug report.

The humans/bots count is missing.

That feature has been introduced in "1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e, amongst other commits.
details.new_value:
There are some online Legacy servers using recent -git snapshots (see screenshot). The x86_64 server uses pre.sdl2.570 while the red server uses 573, which is the most recent version as I type this bug report.

The humans/bots count is missing.

That feature has been introduced in 
"d09e28c7cf662414717bee46d5634adcb756cd53":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/d09e28c7cf662414717bee46d5634adcb756cd53
and 
"1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e.

journals.notes:
-I tried to use "041eeaf1":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/041eeaf1, which is the last commit about the bots counter feature. The issue is the same, so that issue is not a regression. It seems the bot counter simply never worked with... git build? debug build? 64bit build?-

Disregard the above. The responsible commit is "7a49775":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/7a497759dac4448969a2e01950801e6900a189bb.  The ET_VERSION identifier has been changed in #606, so there is no way to make the difference between 2.60b and ET:L server anymore.

Spyhawk wrote:
> so there is no way to make the difference between 2.60b and ET:L server anymore.
Version string is still different, no?

subject: Recent snaphshot of ETL servers don't send the humans/bots count
description:
There are some online Legacy servers using recent -git snapshots (see screenshot). The x86_64 server uses pre.sdl2.570 while the red server uses 573, which is the most recent version as I type this bug report.

The humans/bots count is missing.

That feature has been introduced in 
"d09e28c7cf662414717bee46d5634adcb756cd53":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/d09e28c7cf662414717bee46d5634adcb756cd53
and 
"1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e":https://github.com/etlegacy/etlegacy/commit/1d0dad82a07c6f94dd5c9d68617a077d28f70d5e.
